Text:
Sherry hurries along, checking her surroundings as
she goes.
Her footsteps makes slapping sounds with each step.
Aagh...
*gasp*

Sherry spun around as she felt something move behind
her.

There is the sound of something whooshing through the
air...but no one is there. The still hallway continues on
into the distance.
Phew, guess it was my imagination...

Sherry moves along, surveying everything around her
carefully as she clutches the artifact to her chest.
What happened just now...
Oho, pretty good for not havin' any magic.
They must be using that thing...
And that's why they want this artifact...!

I should be able to find more information in
Foster Father's office...
I've got to do something...!

Sherry's mind turns to the two knights who had fought
in order for her to escape. She won't let their sacrifice
be in vain.
*gasp*

There is the sound of something whooshing through
the air.
Phew, guess it was my imagination...

Sherry steels herself, then crawls on all fours so
she won't be spotted from inside the classroom.
Gyargh...
*gasp*
Phew, guess it was my imagination...

Sherry steeled her resolve again, then walked along
with clacking footsteps.

She checks everywhere thoroughly, from the corners
of the halls to the classrooms and, of course,
behind her.
Her head turns as if on a swivel.

But when busy checking one's surroundings, it's easy
to lose sight of where one is stepping.
Eek...!

The artifact slipped from her hands and flew through
the air.
Someone catches it, along with Sherry.
Opening her eyes, she sees her new friend.
You okay?
Cid...!
Here you go.
Th-Thank you...
But Cid, that wound...!

Oh, don't worry about that. I managed to escape with
my life.

He seems worn-out as he says this to Sherry with half-
open eyes.

But enough about me. There's a few things I need to
say to you.

Like, stop talking to yourself, or stop thinking
about other things when you're trying to walk,
watch your step, that kinda stuff...

But first off, how 'bout we ditch those slippers so
we won't draw any more unneccessary attention?

The place I'm helping Sherry reach turns out to be
the assistant principal's office on the first floor.

She starts pulling out the drawers of the desk as if
she knows what she is looking for.
Looks like the assistant principal isn't in.
No... I just hope he managed to escape safely...
I know he kept it in here...

(I took out five more guys along the way... Looks
like she really is the main character here.)

(But she probably won't be able to clear the quest on
her own. Normally there'd be some kinda partner
character, but...I don't see anyone that fits the bill.)
This is a seriously flawed scenario.

(After a bit of nail-biting, I decide to position
myself as a helper. I'm an extra, and extras
never act outright. Ever.)
Found it!

Sherry comes around from behind the desk holding a
bunch of papers. She sets them down on a table used
for receiving guests.
What's all this?

(I can't make heads or tails out of the jumble of
text, figures, and formulas.)

An artifact called the Eye of Avarice. This is what's
blocking our magic.

(Sherry shows me a sinister-looking sketch of a ping
pong ball-sized orb.)

The Eye of Avarice is capable of absorbing the magic
of any dark knights or arcane objects in its area of
effect and then retaining said magic temporarily.

The result is that training with magic becomes much
more difficult in its vicinity.
But those guys in black were using magic just fine.

It's possible to have the Eye memorize magic
wavelengths you don't want it to absorb.

Otherwise, even the one who uses it would find their
magic drained.

Interesting. So it'll absorb any magic it hasn't
memorized?

This is just a hypothesis, but I don't think the Eye
can absorb magic that is too small for it to detect
or, conversely, too massive for it to contain.
However, people now can't wield that sort of magic...
True.

That alone makes this a tricky artifact to use...
But the truth is that once the Eye has stored all
the magic it can hold, it will release all of it in a
single burst.
A single burst, huh...
Yes, all of it.

Cid... You said that all of the students are gathered
in the auditorium, correct?

If we're thinking about absorbing magic efficiently,
then naturally we're going to want lots of it. That's
why the Eye is likely in the auditorium with all the
dark knights.

And if the magic held within the Eye exceeds its
capacity and all bursts out at once...
It'd blow the Academy to smithereens.

Correct... The nature of the Eye is something I
discovered through research.

In light of the dangers it posed, Foster Father chose
not to present it to scientific circles and instead had
the government take it for safekeeping... But then
why is all this happening?

Could be there's another just like it, or maybe it
was stolen...
So is there a way to stop it?
Yes, this.
(Oh, that flying saucer from earlier.)
This artifact is the Eye of Avarice's control unit.
I learned that after deciphering the script on it.

Originally, the Eye was meant to store magic for
extended periods using this controller.

Extended periods... So you mean it can stop the magic
from getting out.

Exactly! It's incredible, don't you think? If I could
recreate this script for freely storing or utilizing
magic, it'd be a breakthrough to replace the
steam engine...
Okay, so what's our next move?

Once I've finished deciphering this artifact, we'll
go to the auditorium from below.
From below?

Yes. All the facilities in this Academy are connected
by passageways that can be used for escape in
times of emergency.
(Secret passages... Nice.)

If we can activate this artifact and get it close
enough, the Eye should cease functioning.

(That's a more solid plan than I was expecting. The
ending is kinda weak, but if I go as Shadow and
start creating some chaos, it should be fine.)

(In fact, I should be thanking her for setting up
such a killer action scene for me.)
Awesome, let's do that.

The problem is...I left the tools needed to adjust
this artifact back in the laboratory...
Okay, then I'll go get 'em.
What?! But you're injured!
I need to go pee anyway, so it's on the way.
Okay?
Cid...!
